content.description: Start ten feet left of Caliban at the base of an arete. Climb the face just to the right of the arete.
content.location: Cows Hoof area - ~10 fet left of Caliban.

content.description: Climb the flake five to the right of the corner

A right facing corner with a very nice crack in the back. Has excellent finger locks and hand jams all the way up. Plenty of stemming opportunities as well. You can also climb the flake to the right of the corner at a grade or two harder. The bottom of the climb can we wet from seepage.
content.protection: If you wanted to lead it there would be good protection except possibly at the bottom.
content.location: Socrates is the obvious left facing corner 40 feet or so to the right of the crack of F.I.S.T.

content.description: Climb the right facing corner 15 feet to the right of F.I.S.T. The bottom is an overhanging corner and merges into cracks higher up.
Start at the base of the arete around to right of Caliban corner. Climb the arete using holds on the face just to its right.
content.location: To the right of Caliban, at the base of an arete

content.description: A great spot to get a little crack climbing. Follow the crack in the center of the face for 20-25' (ranging from fist to hand width). Careful for the semi-loose flake wedged in the 'Y' of the crack. Move right to a couple nice face moves. Gain the ledge and follow a finger crack (crux) another 15 feet to the top.
content.protection: TR or gear. Trees at top for TR, bring plenty of webbing. Nuts, Hexes, Tricams (bring some huge tricams for down low), as always, the rock at GF doesn't take cams especially well, so use passive pro whenever possible.
content.location: First obvious cliff directly off the side of River Trail after it splits off from Ridge Trail when coming from Difficult Run lot. Furthest left climb on Cows Hoof crag.

content.description: Start at slanting crack in center of crag. Climb the crack to a small dihedral above.
content.protection: Toproping: trees on top if you have an extra long static, some rocks that can be slung at a reasonable distance, also could take some gear up top. Lead: Nuts, Tricams, Hexes, passive pro is always the safe move at Great Falls.
content.location: Cow Pie is below the regular Cows Hoofs area on an outcropping near the water.

content.description: Start 10 feet right of Socrates' Downfall.   Climb the steep face.   Note: A crux hold broke off the original climb in the early 1980s and made this climb much more interesting and a lot harder.
Upstream from the main Cow Hoof ampitheater is a left facing corner.   Climb the corner.
content.location: Just upstream of the main Cow Hoof area.

content.description: Start just left of the left facing corner.   Climb the face.
content.location: Cows hoof area just left of the left facing corner.
